      • parseAbilities

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Ability> parseAbilities(java.io.File inlineFile,
                                                                     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Ability> abilities,
                                                                     CharacterTypePool ctPool)
                                                              throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                                                     java.io.IOException
        Parses the abilities present into a text file.
        Parameters:
        inlineFile -
        abilities - a map of abilities. May be null. Will be modified if non-null.
        ctPool - a pool of existing CharacterTypes. Will be modified if a CharacterType is needed while parsing and does not exists yet.
        Returns:
        a map containing all the abilities, news and olds.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.io.IOException

      • parseCharacterTypeConditions

        private static CharacterTypeCondition[] parseCharacterTypeConditions(java.lang.String[] elements,
                                                                     CharacterTypePool ctPool)
        Parses the class and race elements of the RawAbility into appropriate CharacterTypeConditions. By default, returns a set of size zero to a maximum of the number of CharacterType.Classificiation that exist.
        Parameters:
        elements -
        Returns:
        See Also:
        CharacterType.Classification

      • select

        private static CharacterType select(CharacterType[] found,
                                    java.lang.String type,
                                    CharacterTypePool ctPool)
        Selects the appropriate CharacterType. If no CharacterType has been found, it creates a new CharacterType of the prefered classification, except if the type is "général" and there is no CharacterType with that name. Otherwise if there is only one found, it returns it. If there are more than one found: it will find the one with the prefered parsing classification. If none are found of that classification, it returns the first.
        Parameters:
        found -
        type -
        Returns:
        the appropriate CharacterType
        See Also:
        preferParsingAs

      • parseCondition

        private static Condition parseCondition(java.lang.String str,
